page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {The Prehistoric Salt Industry. There are 11 Redhills on the Langenhoe and Geedon marshes.Redhills are so called because they take their colour from the broken red clay pots in which bronze-age man evaporated sea-water to obtain salt. {Roman Sites. A Roman naval station was located on both sides of the entrance to the Colne Estuary guarding the approaches to Colchester.Villas and substantial buildings have been destroyed by gravel extraction leaving a large lake on Moveron's marshes. {The Brightlingsea Railway.} A single line was constructed between 1850 and 1860,mainly to carry the sprats which formed the main trade of Brightlingsea to market.In 1953 flood waters damaged the embankment and a few years later the line was closed.
